title: Why is the second US presidential debate cancelled in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: I wasn’t even going to answer this but I read an answer that was written so irresponsibly that it used nothing but sheer speculation in saying the moderator controls both contestants too much in a virtual debate. It also described the first debate between President Trump and Joe Biden as “a good example.” What the hell? If that was “good” I’d hate to see bad! As for the amount of control, what control do you mean? That debate was not even close to being in control. It was sloppy as hell, no ifs, ands or buts about it. By the way, the answer to your question is: The debate isn’t cancelled. It will be a virtual debate and it might not be on the scheduled day but if they reschedule that, that’s known as a postponement - not a cancellation. A virtual debate may be the best possible way for a moderator to get these two to actually follow the rules. That last debate was not a serious debate. It was nothing but show business. Don’t believe me? If the people running the debates were really on the up and up, don’t you think they’d cut off someone’s microphone when they’re interrupting? They blatantly allow the contestants to break the rules time and time again, the contestants don’t even answer the questions they’re asked, yet the people in charge of running the debate administer no penalties whatsoever and you’re taking them seriously? How can you? High school sports take their competitions more seriously! There you get a penalty for breaking the rules and get disqualified if you take things too far and those are just games! Keep a reasonable sense of perspective.

The left figures they are ahead…no reason to risk by taking chances. They are using the virus as a reason to hold a “virtual’ debate where Biden can have assistance (teleprompters, ear pieces, coaches) and where each party can have his mic shut off at any time. This prevents one party from asking and demanding answers. Trump won’t accept that…debates are supposed to be symmetrical and the parties should be allowed to go after each other. This format prevents it. A good example would be debate 1……. When questioning in a debate, a moderator must display some symmetry. If you question Trump on “white supremacy” you must also do the same with Antifa and BLM……..if you bring up the handling of COVID -19 you must also touch on H1N1 during the Obama/Biden years….if you bring up Trump’s earnings and taxes or Russia/Ukraine/China you must also bring up Biden’s involvement with them relating to the FISA warrant, Hunter, Joe and his brothers $$ from China and Ukraine. So the data shows that Wallace did not do that. ….and a moderator controls both contestants too too too much in a virtual debate….LESSON LEARNED?
